results.title: Role of catecholamines in calcitonin-induced analgesia.
results.text_hl: A more pronounced and long-lasting inhibitory effect on sCT-@<m>DISEASE_Pain_Insensitivity_Congenital</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000699 @@@analgesia@@@ was obtained using @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (selective beta 1-receptor blocker).

citations.NLM: Guidobono F, Netti C, Sibilia V, Olgiati VR, Pecile A. Role of catecholamines in calcitonin-induced analgesia. Pharmacology. 1985;31(6):342-8. PMID: 3936065
